overview: Olivier is editor-in-chief of Foreign Policy Digest and a former speechwriter for Secretary of State Hillary Clinton. Prior to writing for the Secretary, Olivier was a columnist for the Huffington Post on world affairs. Olivier also serves as an Advisory Neighborhood Commissioner for the Adams Morgan neighborhood and is a volunteer sous-chef at Miriamâ€™s Kitchenâ€”a homeless services organization. Olivier has served on a number of boards including the Board of Trustees of Princeton University and the Board of Directors of the Nepalese Childrenâ€™s Education Fund. He is also a Principal of the Truman National Security Project. Olivier received his B.S.E from Princeton University in Operations Research & Financial Engineering and his J.D. from the University of Pennsylvania Law School where he was an executive editor of the Journal of International Law.
